bot_response: Hey there! How are doing right now?

Perineal Pain or Pain in the Pelvis Area after childbirth has immediate and long-term negative effects for women and their babies
So here are some tips that can help you feel relieved:

->Apply an Ice Pack
->Sit Comfortably
->Have a Warm Bath
->Take your Prescribed Medicines

If the Pain feels too much to deal with, Please Contact your Doctor or a Family Member to Ensure your Safety.
Here are some contacts for nearby Hospitals:

+91-9876543210
+91-9753186420

If you are having contractions after giving birth, do not panic! Your body knows what it's doing and these contractions
help your uterus shrink down to its original size and prevent you from bleeding too much after giving birth.

To Feel more Comfortable, Try Walking around with Assistance.

If the Pain feels too much to deal with, Please Contact your Doctor or a Family Member to Ensure your Safety.

Don't Worry! We are here for you! Post-Childbirth Depression is very Common, So we have prepared some resources that can help you with that:

https://www.thelivelovelaughfoundation.org/helpline

Urinary incontinence — the loss of bladder control — is a common problem, especially after childbirth. 

Kegel exercises can prevent or control urinary incontinence and other pelvic floor problems. Here's a step-by-step guide to doing Kegel exercises correctly.

https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/womens-health/in-depth/kegel-exercises/art-20045283
